description: The Argumentative Microtext Corpus is a collection of short argumentative texts. It comprises 112 texts originally in German, professionally translated into English.
The texts address various topics, such as whether health insurance should cover alternative treatments, public broadcasting fees, and the introduction of capital punishment.
The News Editorials Corpus, also known as Webis-Editorials-16, includes 300 English news editorials from three major news outlets: Al Jazeera, Fox News, and The Guardian.
The corpus has 300 editorials, with 100 from each news source.
The editorials discuss a wide range of topics common in news media, such as politics, social issues, and current events.

The Agreement in Wikipedia Talk Pages (AWTP) corpus includes discussions on Wikipedia Talk pages, where editors collaborate on content edits. The dataset also includes some LiveJournal discussion threads as well

The ComArg corpus is a dataset designed to support argument recognition in online discussions. It comprises user comments on two controversial topics: “Under God in Pledge” (UGIP) and “Gay Marriage” (GM), sourced from ProCon.org and Idebate.org.

The corpus includes 373 comments (175 UGIP, 198 GM), paired with 13 arguments (6 UGIP, 7 GM), resulting in 2,436 initial comment-argument pairs. After adjudication, 2,249 pairs form the gold standard.

The Technical Blogs Corpus captures argumentative exchanges in online technical discussions. Collected from the Technorati platform between 2008 and 2010, it comprises four discussion threads, each consisting of one original blog post and its first 100 user comments.

Topics: 1) Android vs. iPhone: Debates comparing the two smartphone platforms; 2) iPad Usefulness: Discussions on the practical value of the iPad; 3) Twitter as a Microblogging Platform: Arguments about Twitter’s role and impact; 4) Corporate Layoffs/Outsourcing: Opinions on corporate employment practices.

The Argument Annotated User-Generated Web Discourse (AMUGWD) corpus captures real-world argumentative exchanges in online discussions. It focuses on six education-related controversies: homeschooling, public versus private schools, redshirting, mainstreaming, prayer in schools, and single-sex education. Spanning four registers: user comments on newswire articles or blogs, discussion forum posts, blog posts, and newswire articles.
The corpus includes 340 documents with approximately 90,000 tokens, derived from a raw corpus of 5,444 documents with 694,110 tokens.
A filtered version of the Argument Annotated User-Generated Web Discourse corpus, also extended to include documents from other sources, including blogs and newspaper articles.

A large corpus of online discussions from 4forums. This corpus is an extended and refined version of the original Internet Argument Corpus (rescraping and then excluding discussions with only one author). Stored according to an SQL schema
A large corpus of online discussions from ConvinceMe. Stored according to an SQL schema
A large corpus of online discussions from CreateDebate about gun control. Stored according to an SQL schema
The EthiX Dataset is a curated collection of 686 arguments from ethical debates on the Kialo platform.
AAE version 1 (AAE2) consists of 90 essays taken from the essayforum website.
